title: Induced current due to varying B-field

content.question: The circular wire loop shown above has resistance <math alttext="30 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and area <math alttext="3.0 square meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and is fixed in position in the plane of the page. A uniform magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is directed perpendicularly into the plane of the page. The magnetic field begins to decrease, inducing a current of <math alttext="1.0 milliamps" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the loop. The average rate at which the magnitude of the magnetic field is decreasing is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="3.0 times 10 to the power negative 4 Tesla per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>T/</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the power negative 3, the fraction Tesla per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>T/</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3.0 times 10 to the power negative 3, the fraction Tesla per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>T/</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the power negative 2, the fraction Tesla per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>T/</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3.0 times 10 to the power negative 2, the fraction Tesla per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>T/</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the power negative 2, the fraction Tesla per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>T/</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
